availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Hogan Bates. Father of Elizabeth Bates, Lucy Bates, Alicia Bates, Thomas Bates, Ellen Bates, Sally Bates, William Bates, and Mary Bates. Physician in Clay County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Clay County in 1850. Physician in Clay County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 154A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 329.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, p. 5.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 249A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 171B.
Find A Grave, "Dr Stephen Walker Bates (unknown-1887)," Memorial #179781692, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/179781692 (accessed October 2, 2019).
